reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Pavilion on Northbourne this past weekend and overall was very happy with the stay.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel makes a good impression upon walking into the entrance as the atrium makes you stop in your tracks. I haven't seen anything like it so far.
reviews.title: Tired

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Was very impressed on first look at the room, was even suprised that the standard (or deluxe as they call it) room type that we stayed in had a kitchenette!
reviews.title: Overall enjoyable stay
Rude and unpleasant
reviews.text: The only thing i didn't like about the room was the bathroom, it was on the small side with not a whole lot of light. As the bathroom was small, the shower didn't have much room either. My partner spent 5 minutes trying to get the temperature of the shower right so when he finished he kept it on so i wouldn't have to go through the same thing but when i got in it was cold and i couldn't get it hot until the second i decided i'd had enough!

We had breakfast in Cafe Glasshouse and were happy with that. We seemed to have going down at peak breakfast time, so it was very busy and there were only 2 people working and they seemed to struggle to keep up with clearing away the tables to make room for those walking in. Selection was not as much as i was expecting (its $17 per person) but was still very good food and we left full. Only issue was if you wanted a hot drink it was an additional cost that isn't noted anywhere.
reviews.title: Give this one a miss

reviews.text: My friend and I stayed here for one night during a visit to Canberra for an exhibition. Check-in staff were very pleasant and efficient and we were able to leave our bags in the luggage room for the day. Upon our arrival back at the hotel we were given a room on the ground floor adjacent to the restaurant which at first caused some consternation as we thought there could be some noise at night, but our fears were unfounded. We ate in the restaurant that night and I would say that the other patrons were also guests of the hotel so the restaurant emptied fairly early. The food in the restaurant was good but we had to ask for vegetables which came at an extra cost. The bartender also makes very good G&Ts. The room was clean, the beds comfortable and the shower was the best I have ever had. Breakfast the next morning was very good and included in our tariff, as were 2 tickets to the exhibition.
reviews.title: Very pleasant hotel

reviews.text: There are computers for guest use in the foyer but there is a charge for these ($5 for half an hour). We needed to do our on-line check-in and the desk clerk was very helpful and did these for us at no charge. All the staff we encountered were very helpful and cheerful.
reviews.title: cheap and cheerful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As far as some reviewers saying that the location is too far from anywhere, as Northbourne Avenue is the main thoroughfare into Canberra it is well serviced with buses and at no time did we have to wait long.
reviews.title: Highly recommended - definitely 4 1/2 star quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend the Pavilion to anyone visiting Canberra.
reviews.title: Got a good last minute deal for a pleasant stay

reviews.text: Actually I'm not sure if it was cheap or not - my work paid - but that's how I'd classify this place.
reviews.title: Perfect Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I went down for the Masterpieces from Paris Exhibition. Canberra hotel prices seemed even more inflated than usual. I booked through the Pavilion’s website-same price as wotif and no booking fee. Reception was OK, looked presentable and we found we were upgraded to a spa apartment from a deluxe room. The parking lot was very full-especially with tradesmen’s vans. There is a large new hotel being built just behind this one. We weren’t there enough to know if there was noise from that. The carpet in the lift was tired and grubby looking, the ‘atrium’ contains many dusty silk flowers.
reviews.title: Noisy central A/C kept me awake

reviews.text: The apartment was a separate sitting/dining area, small table, 2 chairs and kitchenette with counter, cupboards under and over. A bit surprising as they contained only 2 cups & 2 teaspoons. I am guessing back in the day might have been a toaster etc, although the lack of a sink would have made self cater awkward. I’m not a fan of preparing food in the bathroom. There was a working fridge and kettle.
reviews.title: The best part of staying at this hotel was checking out.
Met all expectations
reviews.text: Large screen TV in sitting room, and a smaller one in the bedroom. Bathroom had a very large corner spa with shower over. There was a handrail, but a less able person might have a problem using it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were no toiletries-instead a gel dispenser by the sink and another by the bath. There was a “save water-recycle your towel” sign,typical of today’s hostelries. But this went further,advising patrons not to brush their teeth with the tap running! And use the dual flush correctly-might have been helpful if there WAS dual flush. But sadly ,the very large 70s cistern was all that was available.
reviews.title: clean cheap rooms on the north side close to buses into the centre and chinatown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we got back from dinner it dawned on me just how loud the A/C was-and cold. I rang reception for advice to be told it was central air so could not be turned off-as for adjusting the temperature, I was advised that it was always slow to re-act.
reviews.title: Definitely one Hotel in Canberra to miss

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel just prior to Christmas 2009 and found the staff to be very considerate and the rooms to be clean and modern. Upon arrival, we were given the opportunity to upgrade our booking from a hotel style room to a 1 bedroom suite for an extra $50. We did not take the offer but were still very happy with the size of our room and the ammenities it offered. The room contained a good sized bar fridge, nice towels and a comfortable queensize bed. The hotel is on Northbourne Avenue, the main road leading into town. There was no road noise but there was some construction noise starting at 7am from the building next door.
reviews.title: Easy access to highways & CBD

reviews.text: The hotel is close to the CBD and local attractions. We found several hotel booking sites with good deals which we used.
reviews.title: Fine, if you don't want quiet, working bathroom, decent service ....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was well appointed and had everything needed except wineglasses, quiet, and a working bathroom.
reviews.title: Yuck!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On site construction caused significant noise, including early on Saturday morning. Earplugs or a warning would have been appreciated.
reviews.title: Worst Hotel Ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Toilet cistern filled irregularly. Shower temperature ridiculously inconsistent and required continual adjusting to stop from freezing or being burned.
reviews.title: Comfortable and Pleasant
